posts.content: Hi Andrew ,looking forward to seeing you all , thanks for the offer of the convoy down , but we are going down on Monday staying at the cider farm again nr taunton camping in an empty field of apple trees if anyone feels like a few extra days Bob n Julie
might be up for wednesday night bob will let you know nearer the date
Sounds good. I'm coming up from Truro and I've got to pick up my daughter who's riding with me at the airport in Exeter weds afternoon.
good facilities ! shop on site

I know what you mean, John no real shop, though taunton is not far, in fact has a public path if you want to walk but the orchard is magic in 2013 all the apple trees had blossom with rabbits ducks chickens wandering around we pitch right in the middle of the orchard all on our own, very chilled toilet block basic as are the showers , but its cheap

1. CCSIceman, 1967 11 Window Devon, Andrew and Michelle
2. John TC, 1956 11 window RHD sunroof kombi, John
3. airkooled 72 1965 11 window aussie import, john and shirley
4. ClausHema 1967 SO42, Dan and Robin
5. Bren Ralls, 1966 11 window , Bren, Sandra & Samuel.
6. Biglozzer 1959 11 window Mango with Devon interior, Loz + 1.
7. Split Bus Kev 1966 11 Window beige n black 'almost a Devon'. Kev & Erin.
8. Robert.copley1 1956 panelvan jacks supermarket oz bob n Julie
9. Jaysk 1965 11 Window RHD Devon Dormobile, Jay, Xiang and 2 year old Milo
10. Bunda 1966 11 Window LHD Arcomobil - Sean, Lauren, Hannah and Viola
11.Geocamper1 1965 11 window LHD Aeron and Archie(dog)
12.Tony & Manda,Busbug&kg,66 11 window,no meerkats,but rusty bumpers!!
LUCKY 13. GreenBeetleDave, 1963 11 window Italian microbus DIY camper. Dave & Jean
Are we talking about "Tanpits" camping in Taunton?
That's the one tanpits
